description:
After a long day out on the water, you want to brag about your day's catch. No one believed your last elaborate tale about landing the largest fish, so you decide to try again. The question remains: how big was it?

It Was This Big is push your luck game with 18 identical cards, where you try to create the biggest fish by laying cards.

The active player places two border cards (head and tail), leaving space in between them. They will then try to fit body parts between those cards. If they manage to do it, they'll score all of the body cards. If they fail, it's next player turn.

The player with the most points is the winner.

SPOILERS: THE GAME - TRAVEL EDITION is a cooperative “guess the movie” game.
 Players must guess the title of the movie from 5 quotes taken from the trailer.

After reading each quote, players must discus the clues and write down 2 movie titles (they can write the same one twice if they are sure about the movie).

The answer comes after the 5th quote. Players get as many points as the number of times they wrote that title.

—description from the designer

Cards are on the table. Start rolling in 3, 2, 1, GO! Who’s got fives? I need two ones! Four cards are drawn from the draw pile and everyone gets six dice of their own color. Fill the card targets with the dice, but you can’t do it alone. Each card must contain dice from two players. Work together to round up the dice needed and collect the points from the card. Will you form an alliance or turn against each other? Find out who’s your friend and who’s your frenemy in this fast paced game of dice.

-description from the publisher

“All the clans are gathered. But confusion reigns in the ranks. Can you organize the horde so that it obeys you, and only you?“
Each clan is identified by the color of its favorite gem. Players lay out cards representing goblins to form battle lines, consisting of rows of twelve cards. Their objective is to align cards of their own color and have a majority of them in as many battle lines as possible, in order to obtain victory points. Each player depends on the hand he Is felt. Fortunately, even it's not their glow, each card in their hands has a unique power that can counter-balance fate and alter the game.
—description from the publisher

Welcome to the The Pie Game card game! Grandma needs your help, she signed up for the local bake sale to make one of her award-winning pies, but her bursitis is acting up and this is preventing her from making her pie. Can you help Grandma make the pie and save the day or will you disgrace Grandma by not getting your pie made?

For 2 to 8 players ages 6 and up. Game setup is simple as each player is dealt 1 of 8 unique recipe cards, such as: Apple Pie, Chocolate Cream Pie, Key Lime and others. Each recipe card lists the 5 ingredients that you need for your pie recipe. Next, each player is dealt 5 ingredient cards. The ingredients are all fresh and delicious with favorites like: Whipped Cream, Lime Juice, Chocolate Cookie Crust, Brown Sugar and Milk.

Game Play is just as easy, each player attempts to collect all recipe ingredients for their Pie as game play progresses through card draw and discard. Players draw new ingredient cards from the pile and discard unwanted ingredient cards from their hand to maintain 5 ingredient cards at all times. But watch out, because three could be trouble at every turn with Fudge and Double Fudge cards with the likes of: “Your neighbor wants to borrow some eggs” or “The cat knocked the sugar bowl off the counter”, these can cause you to discard, trade or pass your pie ingredient cards or even, lose a turn!

The first player to collect all 5 ingredients needed for their Pie recipe wins that round. Once someone completes their Pie, all recipe and ingredient cards are collected and redealt and the first person to win 3 rounds (or as many, or few rounds as everyone wants to play) wins the game… all other players have to disappoint Grandma and tell her they did not get their pie done (or maybe they just lose). So, don’t let Grandma down!

—description from the publisher

"100 Astronauts" is a multiplayer colony building card game set in the deep reaches of space on planet T2853. In the game, you play a highly respected commander that has been sent on a mission to colonize planet T2853. Other highly ranked commanders will try to stop you as your goals & intentions on planet T2853 cross paths. Each game takes around 20-30 minutes and is guaranteed to leave you wanting to play more and more.

Feudal Wars: Medieval Warfare Rules Revised 2nd Edition

The second edition covers the period 1289-1494

Rules for 25mm miniatures

Scale:
1 mini = 20 men
1" = 10 yards

Included army lists:


     French and Late Burgundian  
     French Early Italian Wars
     Easterlings (Brabant, Ghent, Liege, Flanders and Hanseatic League)
     Burgundians
     Imperialists
     Italian City States
     Spanish
     English - Late Hundred Years War
     French - Late Hundred Years War 
     English Wars of the Roses
     Scots


—description from the publisher

The Largest Internet shopping in the Galaxy, Alien Express.
Alien Express, makes each order directly then delivers it straight to the customer.
Make sure that the item matches the picture, or it might be returned to the maker!

Each player takes 5 item cards. Then, at the same time, each player will make the item on the card with play dough.
When the player has finished making the item with play dough. They will shout ‘Delivery!’, other players will have to guess what the item is.
When a single player has made all the different items in their hand, the game ends. 
The player with the most complete cards and guessed the most items wins the game.

-description from publisher

Demeter is a standalone flip-and-write game that features the same graphic style and is set in the same universe as the publisher's earlier game Ganymede.

You are a scientist and you just boarded a ship departing from Ganymede to Demeter 1. Demeter, a red dwarf planet, has two twin moons: Demeter 1 and Demeter 2. Each of them has an ESI (Earth Similarity Index) of 0,98 and the first reconnaissance flight revealed the presence of dinosaurs on Demeter 1. Chahrazad will lead this new expedition as it is now your turn to explore and discover the secrets of the first moon of Demeter!

The goal of the game is to score the most MP (Mission Points). These points represent your ability to discover and to study the dinosaurs in their environment.

Components:

100 Scoring Pads
75 Action cards (15 of each color)      
6 two-sided Species tiles  
6 two-sided Objective tiles  
1 Objective board  
1 rulebook in 2 languages (English and French)
Bonus: 6 Settlers Ship cards for Ganymede

Follow your inner adventurer and explore uncharted lands in the 16th century to create a new frontier colony. Roll your dice and use them wisely to explore, camp, and settle your way to victory. Explore areas to benefit yourself while disturbing other explorers. Make yourself a camp for better reach, and build your settlement in a well-charted area for victory!

Start the game after the direction of the compass is determined, flip all the 7 face-down tiles and every player places their starting camp on whichever tiles they like.  Roll the dice to determine what actions you can take. Each player takes turns to use the dice with the corresponding direction of the hexagon compass to explore (place a tile) or place a camp. You can sacrifice dice to reroll for the rest of the unused dice regardless of your turn.

Placing a camp expands your starting point for exploration and potentially develops into a settlement for victory points. To develop a settlement you need dice with the corresponding number of pips according to the settlement score which is determined by the terrain adjacency of the mentioned settlement, place the dice used as settlement below the pre-existing camp. every player can only develop a settlement once per round. after the players use all of their dice, the round ends and take all the dice not used as a settlement, and start a new round by rolling the dice.

The end game triggers after 2 stack of exploration tiles exhausted or a player have created 4 settlements, finish the present round as usual and starting the last round. The player with the most amount of pip from the dice used as a settlement win.

-description from designer

A group of Mouse Deer and Sheep have broken into the Timun Saving vault. Just right when about to do the deed of stealing, some of them thought to themselves "Aren't stealing is a sin?". Decide your alignment whether you want to help the thieves or sabotage them! Bluff your way through the cards to make yourself the victor.

Set up the game by placing the score tracker, shuffling the cards, exclude 1 card randomly,  and give all the player 1 card. the rest of the cards are placed face down as the vaults. The first player begins by picking any face-down card in the vault, from the 2 cards you have in hand, you can either place one face down and nothing happens, or place them face up then activate the card’s effect. The game ends after all the cards in the vault are opened or game-ending card is revealed in the vault. The score is determined by the card left in the player’s hand. The first player that has achieved 15 points wins.

-description from designer

Escape Room The Game is the game where you need to work together to solve puzzles and to find hidden clues. It’s always a race against the clock; you only have 60 minutes to escape. The Chrono Decoder counts down, creates the right atmosphere and tells you when you can use hints. In this game you either win together or you lose together. All players have to get the best out of themselves. To solve riddles and puzzles in time, teamwork is the key to success. Unbelievable how quickly 60 minutes pass in the heat of the moment.

4 NEW ADVENTURES, CAN YOU ESCAPE IN TIME?
Are you already familiar with Escape Room the Game? Feel the tension of an Escape Room in your own living room again with the four new adventures of Escape Room The Game 2.

Have you not played Escape Room the Game yet? Then you can expect a challenging and unpredictable game!

The German edition contains the following adventures: Alice in Wonderland, Another Dimension, Wild West Express and The Break-In. The last 2 adventures are new ones and not included in the Dutch, Korean, and Spanish version which is found here: Escape Room: The Game 2.
.............................................................

The Break-In

Heute Nacht ist es endlich soweit! Lange habt ihr euch auf euren Einbruch in das Lockholm Museum vorbereitet. Das Ziel? Ein unbezahlbares Kunstwerk der berühmten Künstlerin Esa Cape. Stehlt die Skulptur, versteckt euch vor den Wachen und entkommt ungesehen wieder aus dem Museum, bevor ihr erwischt werdet!

Alice in Wonderland

„Ich komme zu spat!”, ruft ein weißer Hase, während er auf eine Uhr sieht. „Die Teeparty beginnt bald!“

Ein sprechender Hase? Ihr seht nicht richtig! Er hoppelt in ein kleines Loch, und ihr folgt ihm hinterher. Als ihr in einem Raum mit einem riesigen Tisch landet, wird euch klar: hier irgendwo ist der Zugang ins Wunderland! Entkommt in einer Stunde, oder bleibt für immer hier!

Wild West Express

Während einer gemütlichen Zugfahrt nach Escapetown wird der Zug von Banditen überfallen. Sie haben die Lok übernommen und wollen den Zug in einer Stunde in einen Abgrund steuern. Das würde ein böses Ende nehmen…

Überwältigt die Banditen, übernehmt die Kontrolle über die Lokomotive und stoppt den Zug, bevor er den Abgrund erreicht!

Another Dimension

Seit mehreren Monaten passieren komische Dinge in Lockholm. Ihr seid in die nahe Militärbasis eingebrochen um den mysteriösen Ereignissen auf die Spur zu kommen. Doch was ihr dort vorfindet, könnt ihr kaum glauben… hier gibt es ein Portal in eine andere Dimension! Wer wagt sich zu einer besonderen Begegnung?

Story-based crime card game: Crack a tricky case at a music festival.

The cooperative, story-based crime card games "Crime Story" are part of the new detective game series from Noris. They revolve around tricky cases in the 3 different cities Berlin, Munich and Vienna.

During a concert of the FIVE CULTURES it came to a serious accident. The band's manager was electrocuted. Had someone's out to get him? What happened? Who wanted him in cold blood Murder?

In 60 minutes, the players try to find out together what happened and who committed the crime. They decide which traces they want to follow and which they do not want to consider. Clues must be interpreted correctly and secrets must be uncovered.

Lortur í lauginni (Pool Pooper) is a party game in the vein of Werewolf / Mafia games. Players take on different roles (pooper, innocent swimmer, pool attendant, bezzerwizzer etc.) and try to figure out before the end of the game who pooped in the pool. Even though it's similar to Werewolf, there is no player elimination in the game.

—user summary

On your turn, you choose and perform an action that leads you to earn victory points by completing a flag in your gallery. You earn extra victory points when the arrangement flags in your gallery resonates with your motifs and your styles.

Market may provide you a sketch of a flag to the Atelier, or a pigment to the Palette. You may also directly complete a flag sketch from the Market to your Gallery. Depending on its position, you may earn bonus pigments.

The game ends when a player completes all 12 flags in her Gallery. The player with the highest victory points win the game.

Imagician reinvents the principle of dot-to-dot drawing: connect the dots to discover what you are drawing.

In each round, an imagic spell made of several ingredients is revealed. Simultaneously, players connect the ingredients on their board to draw a shape. The first player to guess the shape they are drawing (even if that drawing is incomplete) writes what it is on their board and starts a countdown for the other players. Once the countdown ends, players win points if they guessed correctly what the shape represents.

Each game will have you guess eight objects from more than 225 different spells with various challenges. Codes will lead you to draw specific shapes: curves, multiple lines, circles, etc. This way, your drawings become more and more complex. In the first game, a short tutorial will help you get started immediately and learn the different codes.

—description from the publisher

A strategy card game where you build MRT tracks to reach your destination, while disrupting others and throwing them off track!

Every player starts off with one of the three randomly selected characters from a team; Office Lady, School Boy or the Disruptor. Office Ladies and School Boys have to work with their team to build an interrupted track route to their specific Destination. The first team to get to their Destination wins. The Disruptors have to stop both teams from reaching their Destinations.

How to play:
All players pick a Character Card at random and start by taking 5 cards from the Draw Pile.Place Destination Cards face down at random at the center of the Map. Place Home Cards face up at the 4 corners of the Map The player who took the MRT last starts the game.

On your turn, take one of the following actions:

     Place 1 Track card on the map.
     Play 1 Action card on other players.
     Play 1 Action card on yourself.
     Play 1 Action card on the Map.
     Discard up to 2 cards face down and take back the same number of cards that you discarded.


If you played a card, draw back 1 card from the Draw Pile at the end of your turn.
At the end of your turn, you must have 5 cards in hand.

Components:
1 cloth map (67cm x 67 cm)
132 cards (9 character cards, 4 destination cards, 4 home cards, 48 action cards, 67 track cards)
1 instruction sheet

Wandering through the winding paths of a magic forest Alice stumbles upon a royal garden. Poor gardeners have been rushed off their feet trying to arrange it according to the Queen's wishes. The trees must be as far apart as possible, the rose bushes must be the most sumptuous in the whole Wonderland, and the chess pieces must have a neat path to walk on. Is it possible to achieve all that and be spared the Queen's wrath?

In Alice's Garden, you arrange the garden plants in the most advantageous way and help Alice and the gardeners appease the Queen and grow the best garden in Wonderland. To do this, you place tiles on your individual player boards, with the tiles being of different shapes, 'Tetris-style, and depicting flowers, trees, etc. To win more points, you should fulfill as many requirements as possible.

The game ends after the round in which a player can't place a tile from the supply on their player board. The player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

While enjoying ale at a distant tavern you overheard a mysterious old man speak of vast lands of treasure. You rush back to your village to gather a team of adventurers to seek out the treasure. It turns out you are not the only person who heard the old man.

Bridges Burned is an adventure themed game with the objective to be the first to get all of your pawns to the treasure and bask in your glory as the richest in the land. This game is for 2-4 players and game play is approximately 60 minutes.

How to Play - 5 Easy Steps to Learn, Limitless strategies to figure out

One - Roll the movement die and move your pawns
    Two - Roll the resource die and collect resources
    Three - You may attempt one river cross
    Four - You may construct one blueprint card
    Five - Draw an event card and perform the action on it

—description from the designer

Gather resources, improve your airship and travel through time to deliver goods in the future or in the past.

Clockwork is a resource management, worker placement and pickup'n'deliver game, set in a futuristic steampunk universe. 
Players will, turn by turn, place their influence on the inner board to activate actions, middle board to gain momentum or the outer board to deliver goods. It's a game of either careful strategy or risky tactics, depending on preferred style of play.

In the end, players win by archiving challenges or completing time traveling jobs. The player with the most victory points is victorious.

—description from the designer

Trampoline Park is played over several rounds. At the beginning of each round, the top playing tokens from the piles go to the jumping points placed around the game board. The youngest player starts the game, then players take turns in clockwise order.

From the jumping point, a playing token moves based on how much energy the player puts into the jump. After a token jumps to a tile, it applies a force to the tile (as on a trampoline) and flings any tokens on that tile to adjacent tiles. Then the referee token goes to the next jumping point in clockwise order, and the top playing tokens again go to the jumping points and players take their turns in order again. If a playing token remains at a jumping point, the new token is placed behind the previous one to create an entrance line.

As soon as a player obtains three tiles of the same colors or the same name, they reveal their card and win. Since you don't know the other players' colors, you might do something which accidentally helps another player win, so jump with care!

Vulcanus (ãƒœãƒ«ã‚«ãƒ«ã‚¹) pits one monster player against 1-3 teams of humans, who must co-operate in order to take down the monster.

In more detail, the monster "Vulcanus" has suddenly appeared from the crater of Mount Fuji, the monster being a ruthless giant that erupts lava from its whole body and that continues to evolve and grow as it creates a path of scorched earth on its way toward Japan's capital, Tokyo. The more casualties you create, the more areas you burn, and the more landmarks you destroy, the closer the monster player is to victory.

The Japanese government has set up a "Monster Disaster Emergency Headquarters", and the human players facing off against Vulcanus must learn how to repel monsters by evacuating citizens, extinguishing fires, deploying Self-Defense Forces, and conducting investigations. The more research you've conducted, the more options you will have for your strategy, and ultimately you will be able to manage the situation with a direct attack on the monster.

Sometimes the monster can detect the humans' operation and ruin their plans, so will Tokyo perish in the end? Or will the monster fall instead?

Modern Armor

This rule system evolved from many play sessions of WRG’s Wargames Rules 1950–2000,Advanced Squad Leader, Panzertruppe, and so on.

The objective is a fast moving game that provides verisimilitude, and addresses basic problems present in many games with reaction to enemy actions.

The figure scale is a single vehicle or squad of infantry, with a turn covering (very) roughly five minutes of combat.

The rules are written to allow hex or map measurement, with one unit of distance equaling 50 meters. 
Typical scale is 1”=50m as a decent compromise between the scale of micro-armor figures and playing spaces.

Modern combat is extremely lethal, with the first to detect usually scores hits or kills. Ranges have grown immensely since World War II, where most tank combat was under 700 meters. Avigdor Kahalani famously engaged the Syrians in the Golan Heights during the Yom Kippur War at 3000 meters, and ranges stretched out even further in the Gulf War as computer-assisted fire control came into combat. Artillery support has become ever more mobile and fast reacting, with radar-assisted counter-battery fire. Air support is more nimble, too, especially once laser-guided munitions become commonplace.

Core concepts are the alternating player turn, detection, and defensive fire during the active player’s movement, and cohesion.

Included in this title:

     Complete Rule System, including vehicle and equipment charts covering 1945 to the present day.
     Combat Tables
     Game Counters and Artillery Templates
     Sample historical scenarios


—description from the publisher

Some Corner of a Foreign Field is a squad level modern combat game for 4-15 models per side. Using just a d20 or two, it models close range infantry firefights on boards from 2x2 to 8x8. Make sure you bring plenty of cover, because if you're hit, there's a good chance you're going down - better to not get seen at all!

Including rules for off-board support, casualties and morale under fire, Some Corner of a Foreign Field is a quick and easy game to get the blood pumping and the bullets flying.

—description from the publisher

Stampede is a 2-4 player game (best played with 4) pitting animals of The Savanna against each other in a race for survival.

Players reveal race tiles each turn to progress their animal’s journey, while playing Power cards to either further their progress, or hinder other animals from winning.

Stampede is a game where the animals you choose for your race makes a difference, as anarchy reigns supreme: each animal's power cards can be used by anybody, allowing for some crazy combinations.

—description from the publisher

In Diáspora, 1 to 24 players will try to solve the 24 cards that have an unique code in them. Through an e-mail communication with the interstellar ship where the three main characters of the game are traveling, the players will reveal new mysteries and obtaining new information about the history of the game as they resolve the cards in it.

—description from the publisher (translated)

En Diáspora, de 1 a 24 jugadores tratarán de resolver las 24 cartas que albergan un código único en ellas. A través de una comunicación vía e-mail con la nave interestelar en la que viajan los tres protagonistas de la historia, los jugadores irán desvelando nuevos enigmas y obteniendo nueva información acerca de la historia del juego a medida que van resolviendo las cartas de éste.

—description from the publisher

Decktective: The Gaze of the Ghost is a co-operative investigation game, featuring a 3D crime scene. Players must solve a mysterious case. They play their cards to share information, discard cards that they think will lead them the wrong way, discuss the clues they find with the other players, make hypotheses and deductions to find the solution! At the end of the game, players must answer several questions: Each correct answer is worth points. The more points they get, the better their outcome.

On their turn, players either play a card from their hand and put it face up on the table, sharing the information on it or they discard a card from their hand face down to the archive and are not allowed to talk about the information on it, until the end of the investigation. Each card has a value from 1 to 10 in the upper left corner. A card can be played face up on the table only if its value is equal to or less than the current number of cards in the archive.

—description from the publisher

You work at an animal shelter where lots of animals are brought in every day. You have the task of filling the pens as cleverly as possible, so you can score points. If you plan well, baby animals are even born, which again earns more points. Which animal rescuer scores the most points with the dice?

In Animal Rescue, each player takes a shelter card and a pencil. Remove one white die from the game if fewer than five players are playing.

The player who was the last to pet an animal is the active player and begins the round by throwing all the dice. They then choose one die and place it before them. The player must draw the animal that is on the chosen die in one of the empty pens at the animal shelter. The color of the chosen die determines in which block the animal goes. An animal on the white dice may be placed in any block, except for the baby block. Think carefully about which animal you choose and where it should be drawn because there are various ways to earn points and extra animals.

—description from publisher

"March on the Drina" is a 2-4 player wargame, set in World War I historical period, which covers the Balkan peninsula theater. Austria-Hungary, Germany and Bulgaria are invading Kingdom of Serbia. The goal of the game for Central powers is to occupy all cities in Serbia, while Serbia`s goal is to prevent that and liberate all of its territory.

Each side has four types of units: infantry, cavalry, artillery and generals. The map is divided in hexagons and only one unit can occupy one hexagon. National military capacity is gained by controlling the cities and it is used to reinforce your armies. Each general has special abilities which are forwarded to the troops under his control.

The game lasts 14 rounds max where each round represents one period of 1914-1918 conflict and that period is described on one card of the Calendar and it brings special effects on one round of the game.

—description from the designer

Swear, will you do the right thing?
Judge a criminal case and make your verdict.
In Intimate Conviction, players play as a group of jurors for an evening or a week. First, they will have to analyse the facts against the accused. Once all the actions of the sworn cards have been completed, the game ends with a final vote where the players will have to decide by a majority whether or not the accused is guilty in a criminal case.
With two or more participants, their opinions will be put to the test more than once as the cards and debates unfold! In the final vote, it is only in the face of their firm conviction that they will have to find the way to victory.
Intime Conviction offers you a unique and entertaining gaming experience that will allow you to simulate the role of jury member in criminal court based on real intrigues. To push the immersion in the closed door further, test the 2-person version and keep the suspense going for 1 week!
Intimate conviction is a craft object entirely designed, manufactured and assembled by hand and in Belgium, by two friends who love stories, cats and fika. 
The format of the game is also new: it fits in an envelope.of the game is unusual as well: this game is in an envelope.

— description of a distributor.

Two ways to play:
- In group: Play with friends at a party by recreating the closed door ambiance (about 2h game)
- in duo: Make it last by revealing only a few new elements every day.

How to play (condensed):
Place the crime scene in the middle of the table and give each player a Juror card.
Inspect the crime scene, then read the defendant's deposition. Reveal the Juror cards one by one.
When the Jury is ready to vote, the final vote takes place. If a majority isn't reached, the debate continues until someone switches sides.

The verdict is announced, a final revelation is unveiled (brand new information is discovered).
You win if you settled on the right decision.
You loose if the verdict was inadequate.

"Solitaire Spellbook Swappings" is a minimalistic 9 card PnP puzzle-based game submitted for the 2019 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

Game Summary/Premise: As an apprentice magician, you have been tasked with sorting the Royal Magical Library. Fortunately, the library’s magical tomes have several useful “Swapping” spells available to expedite the process. Prove your magical mettle by successfully sorting the arcane spellbooks!

Components: 9 Cards (numbered 1 through 9 with unique “Swap” abilities on each one). You may print the colored version or the low ink version and use either one.

—description from the designer

EVERYTHING WILL CHANGE…

A pact struck ages ago has finally come due, and now the otherworldly horrors known as the Infernals descend upon Caen to collect their payment. The cost in mortal souls is higher than anyone could possibly imagine, but forces have gathered to stand against these invaders. Holy archons and steadfast soldiers of the Order of Illumination join with armies of all nations to protect humanity from utter oblivion at the hands of ancient evils from without and traitorous individuals from within. The fate of every living being hangs in the balance, and the Iron Kingdoms will be changed forever…if it survives at all.

The Oblivion Campaign Set contains a vault of secrets about the upcoming Claiming, including new fiction detailing the Claiming of souls; a narrative campaign system featuring 16 branching scenarios that allow you and your friends to participate in the invasions; Omen cards that contribute to the outcome of your path to victory or defeat; a brand-new model, the Hermit of Henge Hold, that can play in ANY army; and new and updated rules for Warmachine and Hordes in a convenient digest. This Campaign Set has everything you need to help you defend against those who come to claim souls or to aid them in their decimation of the world.

The Oblivion Campaign Set is a must-have for any Warmachine or Hordes enthusiast. This product moves along the story of the Iron Kingdoms while presenting a campaign for players to take part in the action. The Omen cards included in the box are integral to the campaign system and will be used in future campaigns that use the core campaign rules presented here. The updated rulebook contains all of the rules for both Warmachine and Hordes, integrated into one concise tome for the first time. In addition to the combination of rules, other small adjustments have been made to the game to streamline certain elements. Finally, the included miniature is the Hermit of Henge Hold, a mad Iosan prophet who can be included in any army, ensuring all of the contents of this box fit easily into any player's collection.

Contents:
Oblivion Campaign Book
Exclusive Hermit of Henge Hold Miniature (playable with every faction!)
Warmachine/Hordes Core Rules Remix Digest
20 Omen Campaign Cards

-description from publisher's website

Assault platoon

This book contains all the rules you'll need to simulate a skirmish-level battle between two enemy armies. 
Assault Platoon uses a unique and innovative system to simulate simultaneous actions and reactions that allows you to interrupt or anticipate your enemy's moves. 
Assault platoon is a new dimension in miniature wargaming where realism and simple rules are perfectly balanced.

The whole game-system is based on adding and subtracting six-sided dice.

Fast, easy to learn and historically accurate.

—description from the publisher

The more you swap … the more you score!

Swingers have more fun!

Join the swinging community in the game that’s all about swapping partners, collecting tokens and having fun.

Get creative as you act, sculpt and draw the naughty words on the swingers cards for your partner to guess. Do it before time runs out and you both win tokens. But watch out, your partner may have their eye on another swinger with a lot more tokens than you and given the chance may swap partners… but don’t worry because you can swap partners too!

Try a 3sum and go head-to-head with other swingers for bonus tokens and the choice of a new partner.

Swingers keep swapping partners and collecting tokens until one pair of swingers has enough tokens to win the game.

Why stick with the same team for the whole game when you can swap partners?

—description from the publisher

Le Dernier des Mohicans

Skimish miniature wargame rules in Canada during the French-Indian War 1754-1763.
for 15-25mm 1/72 minis

Sequence of play:

     Missile phase
     Movement phase (inc. charges moves)
     Reloading phase - for arty only
     Mêlée phase
     Moral test phase


Scale:

     1 cm = 2m
     1 mini = 1 individual
     1 turn = 1 min


—user summary

The players start in Frankfurt a. M. and travel either to New York (north route) or Buenos Aires (south route) and back. Movement of the airships is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to complete his journey wins the game.

—first edition

The Patata Burgesa is a game set in the Medieval Potato universe, where players will have to do everything in their power to secure and maintain the prized "Patata Burgesa" card.

The turn:
During each Round, each player has a turn, during which the player can only throw a card and then the action of the specific card will be performed.

The victory:
When as many rounds as players have been made, the end of the game will be marked, and the player who has the “Patata Burgesa” card, wins the game and rules the Potato-Medieval universe.

—description from the designer
Reimplementation of the classic game of Connect 4 with players using a pre-loaded board and to trying to create a Connect 4 by knocking out discs by launching Nerf foam darts from Nerf blasters.

Solar Dominion Fleet Combat is a two player area control game played on a rotating board simulating the orbits of planets, space stations and asteroids around a star. Each player controls several fleets of spaceships and must attempt to capture as much of the solar system as possible, capturing asteroids to gain resources to equip and restore their fleets and planets and space station.

Each turn, the orbit rings rotate, moving both locations and player fleets and changing their relative distances from each other, providing an extra tactical element.

Once a majority of locations have been claimed by either player, the player with the most locations earns a victory point, and the first player to reach the goal wins.

—description from the publisher

Champions of Akathena: Into the Wild is an exciting, fantasy combat board game that uses the Champions Combat System™. This complete boxed game contains everything two to six players need to start playing out exciting tabletop battles, including a complete copy of the core Champions Combat System™ rules.

Set in the fantastical, war-torn world of Akathena, this boxed set contains maps for two different battlefields, the Greywolf Forest and the Heartland Mountains. Players will be able to choose from six different champions who hail from these lands, each with their associated reinforcements. The Huntsman and his trusty Wolf are native to the wilds of the Greywolf Forest, as are the Elven Archer and her Snake companion, and the Elven Swiftblade and her Panther ally. In opposition to these deadly hunters, the Shinobi and pair of Genin hail from the Heartland Mountains, as does the eccentric Gnome Alchemist and her two Gunslinger companions, and the Shapeshifter and her pair of pet Savage Cats.

As a Champions Combat System game, Champions of Akathena: Into the Wild seamlessly integrates with all other games built using the same system, including Champions of Akathena: Blood and Magic.

—description from the publisher

Colt Super Express has the spirit of the original, award-wining Colt Express in the form of a fast-paced, survive-to-win format that players can take anywhere. A 15 minute, battle royale style version of Colt Express.

Players compete to be the last Colt Express rider standing because there can only be one when this train stops. Each round, players will place three of their four (or up to six if using the optional extensions included in the game) action cards face down in a pile to determine what they'll do when they are revealed, including moving, shooting, and more. At the end of the round, the last train car is removed...and so is anyone in it! Bandits are eliminated by being knocked from the train, or by being in the last car when it is removed. The last one remaining wins.

Be ready for an underwater adventure! Travel with a bathyscaphe and take photos of the most interesting animals! If you dive deeply under water, there is a chance that you will catch extremely rare and fascinating specimens. The one who creates the best photo collection and gets the most pearls wins the game.

The game teaches good planning and trains the skill of estimating risk.

Object.
During the game, you dive with bathyscaphe to get the most interesting animal tokens. You use oxygen cards for this. Bathyscaphe submerge and emerge can be done at one time - as long as you have the right number of oxygen bubbles.

The end of the game.
The game is coming to the end when there are no oxygen cards in the deck. Count all the pearls that are on your animal tokens.
The winner will receive the most points for the collected pearls.

—user summary

Fear God & Dread Nought 2nd Ed. covers the period centered around World War I. This game uses the same terms and game system as other Admiralty Trilogy games (Harpoon, Command at Sea, and Dawn of the Battleship). Those familiar with any of these games will have no difficulty stepping into the First World War. A jumpstart scenario allows the novice to play quickly, with several scenarios also being optimized for solitaire play. While comprehensive, the rules are easy to follow for experienced gamers and novices alike. That makes it easy to learn and you know it will be accurate.

Emphasizing playability as well as scrupulous historical accuracy, research for the game has involved many of the best naval historians in the world. The 40+ scenarios in the High Seas Fleet booklet include the well-known big battles like Jutland (broken into three parts, as well as the complete engagment) and Dogger Bank, and many smaller fights. The scenario often include variants, covering historical "almosts" and "what ifs".

—description from the publisher

In Disney Villainous: Perfectly Wretched, each player takes control of one of three Disney characters, each one a villain in a different Disney movie, specifically Cruella de Vil from 101 Dalmatians, Mother Gothel from Tangled, and Pete from Steamboat Willie. Each player has their own villain deck, fate deck, player board, and 3D character.

On a turn, the active player moves their character to a different location on their player board, takes one or more of the actions visible on that space (often by playing cards from their hand), then refills their hand to four cards. Cards are allies, items, effects, and conditions. You need to use your cards to fulfill your unique win condition.

One of the actions allows you to choose another player, draw two cards from that player's fate deck, then play one of them on that player's board, covering two of the four action spaces on one of that player's locations. The fate deck contains heroes, items, and effects from that villain's movie, and these cards allow other players to mess with that particular villain.

Disney Villainous: Perfectly Wretched is playable on its own, and its characters can also face off against those in the Disney Villainous base game from 2018 and the Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core and Disney Villainous: Evil Comes Prepared standalone games in 2019.

Fields of Fire: Fast Play Rules is the fastest way to get started with the system!

You can be up and playing your first game in under five minutes.

Fields of Fire is a miniatures game for combat from 1975 to present.

For 1:285 scale up to 20 mm minis.
One miniature equals one vehicle.

—user summary

With Time’s Up!, guess football-related words in 3 rounds, first by describing them then with a single word and finally by mime. Hurry up, give the best clues so that your team finds a maximum of answers before the end of the hourglass.

If you're a team player, Time’s Up! Football is the game for you! Have fun discovering with family or friends the 40 new object cards evoking football.

Hum and make noise to guess as many cards as possible! Be Soccer with Time’s Up! Football.

—description from the publisher

The great battle between cats and dogs rages on in the card game, Tails of Conflict.

Lead a team of three adorable champions of either cats or dogs (or a mix of both) to battle other teams in this elegantly simple yet fun, competitive card game.

Starting with a deck of ten cards of mostly gold, you will need to buy cards from the Armoury to help your champions gain victory over your rivals.

Combat is resolved with dice. Each champion starts with 1 dice in attack, defence and speed. Equipment such as weapons and armour add dice, while skills and events add dice or allow rerolls.

A champion is captured and taken out of the game once they have 5 hit tokens on them. Capture all 3 of your opponents champions to win the game!

Do you have what it takes to lead your team to victory? Join the war and pledge your allegiance today!

Charlie Murray Grant is the third generation, son of Charles Stewart, and he too has inherited a passion for the wargame hobby. Charlie, with his own 20mm World War Two armies, has developed his late grandfather's rules, added to them and provided a play sheet and instructions for refighting one of the original scenarios. In addition Charlie has added six chapters which were not in the original publication but which appeared in the Mecanno Magazine. In his own words "Battle has stood the test of time and with new content and play sheets it provides an excellent set of rules for up to company level actions".
